meanings.definition: Nearsighted; unable to see distant objects clearly.
meanings.sent1: With myopic vision, she struggled to read the street signs from far away.
meanings.sent2: The myopic student had to sit at the front of the class to see the whiteboard clearly.
meanings.sent3: The myopic squirrel kept trying to climb a tree trunk, mistaking it for a branch.
meanings.sent4: His myopic view of the world limited his understanding of different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The myopic telescope could only focus on nearby stars, missing the beauty of distant galaxies.

meanings.definition: Lacking foresight or intellectual insight; narrow-minded.
meanings.sent1: Her myopic thinking prevented her from considering alternative solutions.
meanings.sent2: The myopic manager refused to listen to any suggestions for improvement.
meanings.sent3: The myopic cat kept trying to fit through the narrow gap in the door, ignoring the open window.
meanings.sent4: His myopic approach to politics made him blind to the needs of the community.
meanings.sent5: The myopic leader failed to see the bigger picture, focusing only on short-term gains.
